metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8934 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
hw/ppc/spapr.c in QEMU through 3.1.0 allows Information Exposure because the hypervisor shares the /proc/device-tree/system-id and /proc/device-tree/model system attributes with a guest.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-block-extra - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-guest-agent - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-kvm - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-arm - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-common - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-data - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-gui - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-mips - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-misc - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-ppc - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-s390x - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-sparc - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-x86 - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-system-x86-xen - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-user - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-user-binfmt - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-user-static - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
qemu-utils - 4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see debian bug for information on this change that may break existing functionnality. This fix will break ppc migration.  we will not be fixing this issue in stable releases, marking as ignored

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0+dfsg-0ubuntu9').
